intro: Tephroseris longifolia subsp. gaudinii, commonly known as the Gaudini's tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showing a high degree of adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of hairs. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
